result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:07 AM Defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez appeared by phone.  Attorney Richard Lance Jones Sr. appeared by video for Vanessa Delray Fernandez.  Attorney David Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Atty received copy of complaint, waives reading.  Waive right to prelim hearing.  Def, has discussed with Atty, understands rights giving up.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Court has reviewed complaint finds PC and finds that a felony was committed in Ashland County case is bound over for arraignment.  State filing information now with same charges in complaint.  Atty waives reading of information, pleads NG, noted.
Status conference scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on November 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Def shall not possess or consume any mind-altering substances meaning alcoholic beverages, controlled substances, inhalants, synthetic marijuana, or similar substances and/or over the counter medications used contrary to label instructions, or prescription medications not taken in compliance with a prescription issued to the defendant.  Def is not to go into any place where mind altering substances are present, maintained, sold or consumed, except defendant may enter a convenience store or grocery store, even if alcohol is sold there. 
Follow all court orders, even those that may be as a result of another county.

2:06 PM Defendant Vanessa Delray Fernandez not in court.  Attorney Richard Lance Jones Sr. appeared by video for Vanessa Delray Fernandez.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Cases 22CF96 and 22CF5.  22CF96 is scheduled as an initial appearance State has not been able to serve.  Attorney stated def should be on the way to the court house, spoke to def about 30 to 45 minutes ago.  Back on the record at 2:23.  Def appears in person.  22CF5 here for STC. 22CF96 is not representing on that case, asking to go to office to see if qualifies and will take.  PO Box 264 Ashland Wi.  No residential address.  Attorney has not received criminal compliant in 22CF96, copy of compliant given to def.  Status of 22CF5, offer is extended not accepted asking to set trial dates.  State comments a 2 day trial.  January 24th and 25th #2 spot.  
22CF96 Ruth Kressel comments on conditions of release.  Court orders $5000 signature bond and ABSOL.  Def needs to go reapply at PD for 22CF96.
